ruleset.name: Best Practices
ruleset.description: Rules which enforce generally accepted best practices.

rule.name: AvoidInlineStyles
rule.description: Don't mix content and style. Use separate CSS-files for the style and introduce classes. This helps to reuse common styles.

rule.name: UnnecessaryTypeAttribute
rule.message: Type attribute for link and script elements is not needed.
rule.description: In HTML5 the explicit type attribute for link and script elements is not needed. Modern browsers expect stylesheets to be in CSS and scripts to use JavaScript.
rule.example:
<!-- Instead of --> <link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="css/styles.css" /> <script type="text/javascript" src="js/scripts.js"></script>
<!-- Just use --> <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/styles.css" /> <script src="js/scripts.js"></script>

rule.name: UseAltAttributeForImages
rule.message: The image is missing an alternate text.
rule.description: Always use an "alt" attribute for images. This provides an alternative text and is extensively used by screen readers.
